title: Skilled — Regional Sponsored visa (subclass 487)
summary: This page provides detailed information for people who have already applied for the Skilled – Regional Sponsored visa (subclass 487), which is now closed to new applications. It explains what applicants can do after applying, how to add family members, obligations for visa holders, and pathways to permanent residency. It also outlines conditions for sponsors and steps required if circumstances change.

visa_details.description: A provisional visa for skilled applicants sponsored by a state/territory government or eligible family member to live and work in a Specified Regional Area.

applicants_information.who_is_this_for: People who have already applied for the Skilled – Regional Sponsored visa (subclass 487)

adding_family_members.when_allowed: Any time until a visa decision is made
requirements: Fee payable unless the child is a newborn

newborn_children.form_name: Form 1022 - Notification of changes in circumstances

other_dependent_children.form_name: Form 1436 - Adding an additional applicant after lodgement

lodgement_methods: Mail or courier to Adelaide office (Attention: Adelaide General Skilled Migration)
adding_family_members.english_language_requirement: Dependent children over 18 may need to provide evidence of English language skills to determine second instalment payment requirements.

points_test.partner_points: If your partner lodged a combined application and meets skilled migration threshold requirements, their evidence might be used to award you points.

after_applying.acknowledgment: The department will acknowledge receipt of your application and documents.

waiting_for_decision.outside_australia: Do not make travel arrangements until written confirmation of visa grant.

in_australia.bridging_visa: You might be eligible for a Bridging visa.
in_australia.bridging_visa_b: If you hold a Bridging visa A, you can apply for a Bridging visa B to travel while awaiting the decision.

providing_more_information.allowed_until: Any time before a visa decision is made
providing_more_information.department_requests: If the department requests further information, you must respond by the set date.
providing_more_information.third_party_information: If another person provides information that may affect your application, you will usually have an opportunity to respond.

alternative_forms.form_name: Form 1446 - Withdrawal of a visa application
alternative_forms.use: If you move to a new address or change your passport

alternative_forms.form_name: Form 1022 - Notification of changes in circumstances

reporting_changes.passport_warning: Failure to provide details of a new passport may cause delays at airports or denial of boarding.

withdrawing_application.allowed_until: Any time before the visa is granted or refused
required_information: File reference number, client ID, or Transaction Reference Number (if known)
withdrawing_application.signature_requirement: All applicants aged 18 or older who wish to withdraw must sign the request.

if_granted: When you can use the visa

visa_holders.visa_length: Valid until the date stated in your grant letter.
visa_permissions: Remain in Australia in a Specified Regional Area
Work or study in a Specified Regional Area
Apply for permanent residency if eligible

requirements: Live in a Specified Regional Area for two years
Work for at least 12 months in a Specified Regional Area
Live, study, and work in regional Australia or a low population growth metropolitan area
state_or_territory_nomination_conditions.notes: Additional residential conditions may apply based on nomination requirements.

requirements: Live, study, and work in a designated area
Provide proof of time spent in that area when applying for permanent residence

non_compliance_consequences: Visa cancellation for you and your family
Ineligibility to apply for a similar visa while in Australia
visa_holders.passport_warning: Not providing details of a new passport could lead to airport delays or denial of boarding.
